Name: Lavender Honey Sour
Ingredients: 10 ml Honey syrup (3 parts honey to 1 water by weight)
15 ml Egg white (pasteurised) or 																																			Aquafaba (chickpea water)																								 or 3 dashes Fee Brothers Fee Foam cocktail foamer
3 dash Peychaud's or other Creole-style bitters
Instructions: Select and pre-chill a Flute glass .
SHAKE all ingredients with ice and strain back into shaker.
Review: An Irish whiskey sour sweetened with honey and herbal liqueur with Creole bitters adding aromatics.
History: Adapted from a recipe created in 2006 by Dre Masso at Lonsdale in Notting Hill, London, England. Sours cocktail history
Nutrition: One serving of Lavender Honey Sour contains 183 calories
